meanings.definition: To embrace someone or something tightly with one's arms.
meanings.sent1: She was hugging her teddy bear tightly.
meanings.sent2: The siblings were hugging each other goodbye.
meanings.sent3: The tree seemed to be hugging the fence with its branches.
meanings.sent4: The warm blanket was hugging her cold body.
meanings.sent5: The child was hugging the puppy with pure joy.

meanings.definition: The act of holding someone or something closely in one's arms.
meanings.sent1: His hugging of the injured bird showed kindness.
meanings.sent2: The group shared a warm hugging after the victory.
meanings.sent3: The hugging of the overstuffed suitcase made it burst open.
meanings.sent4: The hugging of the waves against the shore was calming.
meanings.sent5: The baby's hugging of the stuffed toy was adorable.
